previous_headings: Development Commands
title: CLAUDE.md
text: IMPORTANT: Always use ---cran flag checking CRAN submission catch potential issues: Target: 0 NOTEs, 0 WARNINGs, 0 ERRORs CRAN acceptance. ---cran flag enables additional checks CRAN uses, including: - Stricter file structure validation - Detection non-standard files - Enhanced dependency checking - comprehensive code analysis
code: # Build and check with CRAN standards R CMD build . R CMD check --as-cran packagename_version.tar.gz  # Alternative using devtools devtools::check(args = c('--as-cran'))

title: CLAUDE.md
text: CRITICAL: committing repository, commit messages must NEVER mention ‚Äúclaude‚Äù, ‚Äúai‚Äù, ‚ÄúClaude Code‚Äù, AI-related terms. commits appear regular human development work.

previous_headings: Code Architecture
title: CLAUDE.md
text: package built around two main R6 classes: Handles database connections Supports multiple database drivers (SQL Server, PostgreSQL) Manages connection configuration, authentication, connection lifecycle Represents individual database tables Provides methods data manipulation (insert, upsert, delete) Handles table structure management (indexes, constraints) Built top DBConnection_v9

previous_headings: Code Architecture
title: CLAUDE.md
text: package includes comprehensive validation system validators : - Field types validation (validator_field_types_*) - Field contents validation (validator_field_contents_*) - Support custom schema formats (e.g., csfmt_rts_data_v1, csfmt_rts_data_v2)

previous_headings: Code Architecture
title: CLAUDE.md
text: get_table_names_and_info.R: Database-specific functions retrieve table metadata (names, row counts, sizes) util_database.R: Low-level database utilities file operations data loading drop_rows_where.R: Functions conditional row deletion

previous_headings: Code Architecture
title: CLAUDE.md
text: R/: Main source code man/: Generated documentation files vignettes/: Package vignettes (use _PRECOMPILER.R build .Rmd.orig) data/: Package data (includes nor_covid19_cases_by_time_location) data-raw/: Raw data processing scripts

title: CLAUDE.md
text: package supports multiple database backends: - Microsoft SQL Server (via ODBC) - PostgreSQL - backend specific implementations metadata retrieval operations

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Uses R6 classes object-oriented database interactions Depends data.table efficient data manipulation Uses DBI odbc database connectivity Includes comprehensive field validation system data quality Package follows roxygen2 documentation standards Uses devtools workflow development

title: Introduction to csdb
code: dbconnection <- csdb::DBConnection_v9$new(   driver = Sys.getenv("CS9_DBCONFIG_DRIVER"),   server = Sys.getenv("CS9_DBCONFIG_SERVER"),   port = as.integer(Sys.getenv("CS9_DBCONFIG_PORT")),   db = Sys.getenv("CS9_DBCONFIG_DB_ANON"),   user = Sys.getenv("CS9_DBCONFIG_USER"),   password = Sys.getenv("CS9_DBCONFIG_PASSWORD"),   sslmode = Sys.getenv("CS9_DBCONFIG_SSLMODE") ) dbconnection #> (disconnected) #>  #> Driver:              PostgreSQL Unicode  #> Server:              db  #> Port:                5432  #> DB:                  postgres  #> User:                yourusername  #> Password:            *********************  #> Trusted connection:  x dbconnection$connect()  dbconnection$connection #> <OdbcConnection> yourusername@db #>   Database: postgres #>   PostgreSQL Version: 17.0.5 dbconnection$autoconnection #> <OdbcConnection> yourusername@db #>   Database: postgres #>   PostgreSQL Version: 17.0.5 dbconnection #> (connected) #>  #> Driver:              PostgreSQL Unicode  #> Server:              db  #> Port:                5432  #> DB:                  postgres  #> User:                yourusername  #> Password:            *********************  #> Trusted connection:  x  dbconnection$disconnect() dbconnection$connection #> Error: external pointer is not valid class(dbconnection$connection) #> [1] "PostgreSQL" #> attr(,"package") #> [1] "odbc" class(dbconnection$autoconnection) #> [1] "PostgreSQL" #> attr(,"package") #> [1] "odbc"  dbtable <- csdb::DBTable_v9$new(   dbconfig = list(     driver = Sys.getenv("CS9_DBCONFIG_DRIVER"),     server = Sys.getenv("CS9_DBCONFIG_SERVER"),     port = as.integer(Sys.getenv("CS9_DBCONFIG_PORT")),     db = Sys.getenv("CS9_DBCONFIG_DB_ANON"),     schema = Sys.getenv("CS9_DBCONFIG_SCHEMA_ANON"),     user = Sys.getenv("CS9_DBCONFIG_USER"),     password = Sys.getenv("CS9_DBCONFIG_PASSWORD"),     sslmode = Sys.getenv("CS9_DBCONFIG_SSLMODE")   ),   table_name = "anon_test",   field_types = c(       "granularity_time" = "TEXT",       "granularity_geo" = "TEXT",       "country_iso3" = "TEXT",       "location_code" = "TEXT",       "border" = "INTEGER",       "age" = "TEXT",       "sex" = "TEXT",       "isoyear" = "INTEGER",       "isoweek" = "INTEGER",       "isoyearweek" = "TEXT",       "season" = "TEXT",       "seasonweek" = "DOUBLE",       "calyear" = "INTEGER",       "calmonth" = "INTEGER",       "calyearmonth" = "TEXT",       "date" = "DATE",       "covid19_cases_testdate_n" = "INTEGER",       "covid19_cases_testdate_pr100000" = "DOUBLE"     ),     keys = c(       "granularity_time",       "location_code",       "date",       "age",       "sex"     ),     indexes = list(       "ind1" = c("granularity_time", "granularity_geo", "country_iso3", "location_code", "border", "age", "sex", "date", "isoyear", "isoweek", "isoyearweek")     ),     validator_field_types = csdb::validator_field_types_blank,     validator_field_contents = csdb::validator_field_contents_blank ) dbtable$drop_all_rows() dbtable$insert_data(csdb::nor_covid19_cases_by_time_location) dbtable$connect() dbtable$dbconnection$is_connected() #> [1] TRUE dbtable$tbl() #> # Source: what: R6 Class representing a database connection ‚Äî DBConnection_v9
title: R6 Class representing a database connection ‚Äî DBConnection_v9
text: robust database connection manager handles connections various database systems including Microsoft SQL Server PostgreSQL. class provides connection management, authentication, automatic reconnection capabilities.

title: R6 Class representing a database connection ‚Äî DBConnection_v9
text: DBConnection_v9 class encapsulates database connection logic provides consistent interface connecting different database systems. supports trusted connections user/password authentication, handles connection failures gracefully, provides automatic reconnection functionality. Key features: Support multiple database systems (SQL Server, PostgreSQL) Automatic connection management retry logic Secure credential handling Connection status monitoring Graceful error handling recovery

text: config Configuration details database.

text: connection Database connection. autoconnection Database connection automatically connects possible.

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create a SQL Server connection db_config <- DBConnection_v9$new(   driver = "ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server",   server = "localhost",   port = 1433,   db = "mydb",   user = "myuser",   password = "mypass" )  # Connect to the database db_config$connect()  # Check connection status db_config$is_connected()  # Use the connection tables <- DBI::dbListTables(db_config$connection)  # Disconnect when done db_config$disconnect()  # PostgreSQL example pg_config <- DBConnection_v9$new(   driver = "PostgreSQL",   server = "localhost",   port = 5432,   db = "mydb",   user = "myuser",   password = "mypass" )  pg_config$connect() # ... use connection ... pg_config$disconnect() } # }

what: R6 Class representing a database table with advanced data management capabilities ‚Äî DBTable_v9
title: R6 Class representing a database table with advanced data management capabilities ‚Äî DBTable_v9
text: comprehensive database table management class provides high-level operations data manipulation, schema validation, table administration. class combines database connectivity data validation efficient bulk operations.

title: R6 Class representing a database table with advanced data management capabilities ‚Äî DBTable_v9
text: DBTable_v9 class sophisticated database table abstraction provides: Core functionality: Table creation schema management Data insertion bulk loading capabilities Upsert operations (insert update) Index management (creation, deletion) Data validation customizable validators Integration dplyr data queries Advanced features: Automatic table creation based field specifications Schema validation custom validator functions Efficient bulk data loading using database-specific methods Index optimization query performance Cross-database compatibility (SQL Server, PostgreSQL) Data validation: class supports custom validation functions field types data contents, ensuring data integrity schema compliance.

title: R6 Class representing a database table with advanced data management capabilities ‚Äî DBTable_v9
text: dbconnection Database connection. dbconfig Configuration details database. table_name Name table database. table_name_short_for_mssql_fully_specified_for_postgres Fully specified name table database (e.g. \[db\].\[dbo\].\[table_name\]). table_name_short_for_mssql_fully_specified_for_postgres_text Fully specified name table database (e.g. \[db\].\[dbo\].\[table_name\]). table_name_fully_specified Fully specified name table database (e.g. \[db\].\[dbo\].\[table_name\]). table_name_fully_specified_text Fully specified name table database (e.g. \[db\].\[dbo\].\[table_name\]) text string. field_types types column database table (INTEGER, DOUBLE, TEXT, BOOLEAN, DATE, DATETIME). field_types_with_length field_types (100) added end TEXT fields. keys combination variables uniquely identify row database. keys_with_length keys (100) added end TEXT fields. indexes named list vectors (generally "ind1", "ind2", etc.) improves speed data retrieval operations database table. validator_field_contents function validates data inserted database. load_folder temporary folder used write data inserting database. censors named list censors.

title: R6 Class representing a database table with advanced data management capabilities ‚Äî DBTable_v9
text: DBTable_v9$new() DBTable_v9$print() DBTable_v9$connect() DBTable_v9$disconnect() DBTable_v9$table_exists() DBTable_v9$create_table() DBTable_v9$remove_table() DBTable_v9$insert_data() DBTable_v9$upsert_data() DBTable_v9$drop_all_rows() DBTable_v9$drop_rows_where() DBTable_v9$keep_rows_where() DBTable_v9$drop_all_rows_and_then_upsert_data() DBTable_v9$drop_all_rows_and_then_insert_data() DBTable_v9$tbl() DBTable_v9$print_dplyr_select() DBTable_v9$add_indexes() DBTable_v9$drop_indexes() DBTable_v9$confirm_indexes() DBTable_v9$nrow() DBTable_v9$info() DBTable_v9$clone()

title: R6 Class representing a database table with advanced data management capabilities ‚Äî DBTable_v9
text: dbconfig Configuration details database (driver, server, port, db, schema, user, password, trusted_connection, sslmode, role_create_table). table_name Name table database. field_types types column database table (INTEGER, DOUBLE, TEXT, BOOLEAN, DATE, DATETIME). keys combination variables uniquely identifies row data table. indexes named list vectors (generally "ind1", "ind2", etc.) improves speed data retrieval operations database table. validator_field_types function validates field_types DB schema created. validator_field_contents function validates data inserted database.

title: R6 Class representing a database table with advanced data management capabilities ‚Äî DBTable_v9
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create database connection db_config <- list(   driver = "ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server",   server = "localhost",   db = "mydb",   user = "myuser",   password = "mypass" )  # Define table schema field_types <- c(   "id" = "INTEGER",   "name" = "TEXT",   "value" = "DOUBLE",   "date_created" = "DATE" )  # Create table object my_table <- DBTable_v9$new(   dbconfig = db_config,   table_name = "my_data_table",   field_types = field_types,   keys = c("id"),   validator_field_types = validator_field_types_blank,   validator_field_contents = validator_field_contents_blank )  # Create table in database my_table$create_table()  # Insert data sample_data <- data.frame(   id = 1:3,   name = c("Alice", "Bob", "Charlie"),   value = c(10.5, 20.3, 15.7),   date_created = as.Date("2023-01-01") ) my_table$insert_data(sample_data)  # Query data using dplyr result <- my_table$tbl() |>   dplyr::filter(value > 15) |>   dplyr::collect()  # Add indexes for performance my_table$add_indexes(c("name", "date_created"))  # Upsert (insert or update) data new_data <- data.frame(   id = 2:4,   name = c("Bob_Updated", "Charlie", "David"),   value = c(25.0, 15.7, 30.2),   date_created = as.Date("2023-01-02") ) my_table$upsert_data(new_data) } # }

what: Get table names, number of rows, and size information ‚Äî get_table_names_and_info
title: Get table names, number of rows, and size information ‚Äî get_table_names_and_info
text: Retrieves comprehensive information database tables including names, row counts, storage size metrics. function provides database-specific implementations different database systems.

title: Get table names, number of rows, and size information ‚Äî get_table_names_and_info
Get table names, number of rows, and size information ‚Äî get_table_names_and_info
text: connection database connection object (e.g., dbConnect)

title: Get table names, number of rows, and size information ‚Äî get_table_names_and_info
text: data.table containing table information columns: table_name Character. Name table nrow Numeric. Number rows table size_total_gb Numeric. Total size table gigabytes size_data_gb Numeric. Size data gigabytes size_index_gb Numeric. Size indexes gigabytes

title: Get table names, number of rows, and size information ‚Äî get_table_names_and_info
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Microsoft SQL Server example con <- DBI::dbConnect(odbc::odbc(),                        driver = "ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server",                       server = "localhost",                        database = "mydb") table_info <- get_table_names_and_info(con) print(table_info) DBI::dbDisconnect(con)  # PostgreSQL example   con <- DBI::dbConnect(RPostgres::Postgres(),                       host = "localhost",                       dbname = "mydb",                       user = "user") table_info <- get_table_names_and_info(con) print(table_info) DBI::dbDisconnect(con) } # }

title: Blank data contents validator ‚Äî validator_field_contents_blank
code: # This validator always returns TRUE regardless of input test_data <- data.frame(id = 1:3, name = c("A", "B", "C"), value = c(10, 20, 30)) validator_field_contents_blank(test_data) #> [1] TRUE  # Works with any data structure empty_data <- data.frame() validator_field_contents_blank(empty_data) #> [1] TRUE

what: Field contents validator for csfmt_rts_data_v1 schema ‚Äî validator_field_contents_csfmt_rts_data_v1
title: Field contents validator for csfmt_rts_data_v1 schema ‚Äî validator_field_contents_csfmt_rts_data_v1
text: Validates data contents conform csfmt_rts_data_v1 schema specification. validator checks granularity_time granularity_geo fields contain valid values according surveillance data format requirements.

title: Field contents validator for csfmt_rts_data_v1 schema ‚Äî validator_field_contents_csfmt_rts_data_v1

title: Field contents validator for csfmt_rts_data_v1 schema ‚Äî validator_field_contents_csfmt_rts_data_v1
text: TRUE data valid csfmt_rts_data_v1, FALSE otherwise (error attribute)

title: Field contents validator for csfmt_rts_data_v1 schema ‚Äî validator_field_contents_csfmt_rts_data_v1
code: # Valid data for csfmt_rts_data_v1 valid_data <- data.frame(   granularity_time = c("date", "isoyearweek", "total"),   granularity_geo = c("nation", "county", "municip"),   stringsAsFactors = FALSE ) validator_field_contents_csfmt_rts_data_v1(valid_data) #> [1] FALSE #> attr(,"var") #> [1] "date"  # Invalid data (wrong granularity_geo value) invalid_data <- data.frame(   granularity_time = "date",   granularity_geo = "invalid_geo",   stringsAsFactors = FALSE ) validator_field_contents_csfmt_rts_data_v1(invalid_data) #> [1] FALSE #> attr(,"var") #> [1] "granularity_geo"

title: Field types validator for csfmt_rts_data_v1 schema ‚Äî validator_field_types_csfmt_rts_data_v1
code: # Valid field types for csfmt_rts_data_v1 valid_fields <- c(   "granularity_time" = "TEXT",   "granularity_geo" = "TEXT",    "country_iso3" = "TEXT",   "location_code" = "TEXT",   "border" = "INTEGER",   "age" = "TEXT",   "sex" = "TEXT",   "isoyear" = "INTEGER",   "isoweek" = "INTEGER",   "isoyearweek" = "TEXT",   "season" = "TEXT",   "seasonweek" = "DOUBLE",   "calyear" = "INTEGER",   "calmonth" = "INTEGER",   "calyearmonth" = "TEXT",   "date" = "DATE",   "cases_n" = "INTEGER" ) validator_field_types_csfmt_rts_data_v1(valid_fields) #> [1] TRUE  # Invalid field types (wrong structure) invalid_fields <- c("id" = "INTEGER", "name" = "TEXT") validator_field_types_csfmt_rts_data_v1(invalid_fields) #> [1] FALSE

title: Version 2025.7.28
text: Fixed namespace loading error importing methods::initialize generic Improved error handling .onLoad() function S7 operations Package now passes CRAN namespace loading requirements

title: Version 2025.7.19
text: Fixed DBConnection_v9 print method display ‚ÄúSSL mode‚Äù instead ‚Äútrusted connection‚Äù PostgreSQL connections

title: Version 2025.7.19
text: Added S7 package imports preparation S3 S7 method conversion improve CRAN compliance S7 transition planned reduce exported API surface maintaining functionality R6 classes

title: Version 2025.7.17
text: Updated package CRAN submission comprehensive improvements Added comprehensive documentation examples exported functions Fixed critical CRAN compliance issues including system tool availability checks Added proper R6 class documentation detailed usage examples Improved validator function documentation clear examples Added missing dependencies fixed import declarations Updated .Rbuildignore exclude system files build artifacts Added CLAUDE.md future development guidance Fixed vignette title improved documentation quality functions now pass R CMD check acceptable NOTEs

text: Including role_create_table drop_table PostgreSQL.

title: Version 2024.3.11
text: Including use_count argument nrow DBTable_v9, slower accurate.

title: Version 2024.3.7
text: Including confirm_insert_via_nrow DBTable_v9. Checks nrow() insert insert. nrow() increased sufficiently, attempt upsert.

title: Version 2023.4.14

title: Version 2023.4.12

title: Version 2023.4.4
text: confirm_indexes now added DBTable_v9, confirms names number indexes database R code. confirm contents indexes! nrow now added DBTable_v9, application new get_table_names_and_nrow function. get_table_names_and_nrow added exported function, get table names nrows dbconnection.

title: Version 2023.4.2
text: create_table now automatically adds indexes.

title: Version 2023.3.31
text: Removing info messages drop_rows_where.

title: Version 2023.3.8
text: connect() DBConnection_v9 smarter, robust error checking making fewer useless calls db. Tries connect twice now throwing error. autoconnection now robust DBConnection_v9.

title: Version 2023.2.17
